messages.message: NatWest would like to understand what *quality assurance mechanisms* we have in place when testing and running models. (FYI - model here refers to both ML classification as well as complex logic / extraction logic)

the customer usually maintains a set of pre-prod golden data that our flow will run on when we have a new version waiting to go to production. in other words, the quality assurance mechanism is golden test on customer golden datasets
hmmm They know this, so I think they were after more than this - @vineeth Can you provide more detail to this?

They need something like logging human reviewer changes as an indicator of extraction quality. Also they need to route the STP cases (cases with no validation errors) and check if they are actually of high quality.

Then as i answered in other channels there are no builtin ways to do those. We can use a postflow UDF at the end of the flow to check if the file 1) has been reviewed (straight-through or not) and 2) if reviewed, what’s the changes made by comparing the output of the checkpoint step with the refiner or classifier step. For the STP files to find out `if there are actually of high quality` they need to have the operators to randomly check a few and see.
